intro: Myoporum adscendens, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in clusters at the ends of the stems. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. Myoporum adscendens is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for native wildlife.
